newsitem.title: USA: CyberGuard says Q2 firewall revenues rise.
newsitem.headline: CyberGuard says Q2 firewall revenues rise.

text.p: CyberGuard Corp said it will post revenue of about $3.0 million in sales of firewall-related products for the second quarter ended December 31, compared with $1.8 million in firewall-related revenue for the year-earlier period.
The 1995 comparison excludes sales of the company's real-time division, which was sold to Concurrent Computer Corp in June 1996, the company said.
The company said it shipped 119 firewall units in the second quarter, compared with 103 units for the quarter ended September 30, 1996, which had revenue of $3.1 million.
The company said that about half of the units it shipped were its new Intel Corp -based Firewall 3.0 product.
The company also said it posted record international firewall revenues and unit sales growth for the quarter, while its U.S. revenues were below those of the previous quarter.
The company said it will release its earnings on January 30, 1997.
